New Records: Mohammed Shami's figures of 5 for 18 are his personal best in ODIs.
Shami now has four five-fors in ODIs, the most by an Indian.
Shami is now the leading wicket-taker for India in World Cups, going past Zaheer Khan and Javagal Srinath's tally of 44 each.
India's 357/8 is the highest team total without an individual century at the World Cup.
India recorded their seventh 350-plus total in 2023, the joint-most by any team in a calendar year.
Shreyas Iyer's 106-meter six is the longest in this World Cup.
Virat Kohli completed 1000 runs in ODIs this year for the eighth time, going past Tendulkar's record of seven.
Key Match Events: India won by 302 runs, the fourth-largest win margin ever in ODIs.
Mohammed Shami took 5 wickets for 18 runs.
Dilshan Madushanka took 5 wickets for 80 runs.
Sri Lanka were bowled out for 55 runs in 19.4 overs.
Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Siraj both took wickets with their first legal balls.
Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka's stand-in captain Kusal Mendis opted to bowl first, believing the pitch would be better for batting in the second innings.
India wanted to bat first anyway, according to Rohit Sharma.
Sri Lanka players wore black armbands to pay tribute to Percy Abeysekera, the legendary cheerleader who died earlier this week.
Rohit Sharma mentioned that there would be some assistance for bowlers at the start and then at night, it would be nice for their seamers to bowl.
Post-Match Reflections: Shami was named Player of the Match for his figures of 5 for 18.
India became the first team to qualify for the semi-finals of the tournament.
Sri Lanka's campaign is now hanging by a thread.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Wankhede Stadium, Mumbai.
The pitch was the same one where South Africa scored 399 for 7 against England earlier in the tournament.
A statue of Sachin Tendulkar was unveiled at Wankhede Stadium on the eve of the match.
